column2: TEXAS PRACTICE PERMIT TEST
column4: Texas
column6: TX

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. If you are continuallyÂ being passed on the right, you should:
column4: move into the right lane and allow other vehicles to pass you on the left.
column6: move into the left lane and allow other vehicles to pass you on the right.
column8: pull over to the right and stop until the road is clear.

column2: 2. This road sign means:
column4: Keep right, traffic is entering from another road.
column6: Keep right
column8: Divided highway ends

column2: 3. When meeting a car with blinding headlights, you should:
column4: look toward the left side of the road.
column6: use your emergency flashers to warn the other driver.
column8: look toward the right side of the road.
column10: dim your lights, then speed up and pass quickly.

column2: 4. You go with a group of friends to a social event, and you plan to have a few drinks. You should:
column4: make alcohol the focus of the event.
column6: avoid alternating between drinks with alcohol and drinks without any alcohol.
column8: arrange to ride home with a friend who does not drink.
column10: stop drinking several minutes before you intend to leave.

column2: 5. When making a turn, drivers must _____ their speed.
column4: maintain
column6: double
column8: reduce

column2: 6. This road sign means:
column4: No U-turn
column6: Road curves ahead
column8: No left turn

column2: 7. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: their lane has a solid yellow center line.
column6: they approach a curve on a two-way road and can not see around it.
column8: they can not safely return to the right lane before any oncoming vehicle comes within 200 feet of them.

column2: 8. When approaching a curve, remember to:
column4: drive at the posted speed limit as you enter the curve, then slow down gradually.
column6: accelerate slightly before entering the curve.
column8: slow down before entering the curve.
column10: drive at the posted speed limit throughout the curve.

column2: 9. This sign means:
column4: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.
column6: The road will curve to the right, then to the left.
column8: Road slippery when wet. Drive slowly.

column2: 10. This sign means drivers should:
column4: come to a complete stop and check for oncoming traffic before proceeding.
column6: give the right-of-way to traffic on the road they wish to enter.
column8: proceed at normal speed through the upcoming intersection.

column2: 21. Anything that requires you to _______ could cause you to crash.
column4: take your attention away from driving
column6: take your hands off the wheel
column8: take your eyes off the road

column2: 22. Drivers are required to stop:
column4: where there is a red light.
column6: when a traffic officer orders them to stop.
column8: at an intersection with a stop sign.

column2: 23. When driving in heavy traffic, you should:
column4: drive slower than the flow of traffic.
column6: maintain a constant speed.
column8: drive with the flow of traffic.
column10: drive faster than the flow of traffic.

column2: 24. When they see a yellow X signal, drivers should:
column4: come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.
column6: stay in their lane.
column8: turn off the ignition.
column10: prepare to leave the lane safely.

column2: 25. If the entrance lane is too short to allow acceleration to highway speed, you should:
column4: stop and wait for a large gap in traffic, then enter the highway and accelerate quickly.
column6: merge into highway traffic as soon as possible.
column8: go to the next entrance ramp.

column2: 26. A broken yellow line alongside a solid yellow line means:
column4: Passing is permitted on the side of the solid yellow line
column6: Passing is not permitted in either direction
column8: Passing on the right is permitted in either direction
column10: Passing is permitted on the side of the broken yellow line

column2: 27. What should drivers do when the red lights begin to flash?
column4: Slow down.
column6: Yield.
column8: Turn off the ignition.

column2: 28. When the road is slippery, you should:
column4: press your brakes in slow, steady strokes.
column6: use your emergency or parking brake.
column8: pump your brakes.

column2: 29. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: vehicles must leave the pavement immediately.
column6: the road surface ahead changes to a low-type surface or earth road.
column8: the dirt on the side of the road is soft.

column2: 30. This sign means:
column4: Vehicles may only turn left.
column6: The center lane is shared for left turns.
column8: Left turns in both directions of travel are not permitted.
